message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We use a combination of data from three sources, namely the National Health Interview Survey, the National Survey on Drug Use and Health, and the Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance System, to comprehensively investigate patterns and correlates of tobacco use among youth in the US.", "dataset": ["National Health Interview Survey", "National Survey on Drug Use and Health", "Youth Risk Behavior Surveillance System"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we utilized data from the International Energy Agency, the World Bank, and the International Atomic Energy Agency to assess the role of nuclear energy in the context of global energy security.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "World Bank", "International Atomic Energy Agency"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using cross-sectional household survey data from Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS), we examined the relationship between women's autonomy and child stunting in sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We complemented administrative tax data with firm-level census data to estimate the effect of value-added tax compliance on the informal sector in Ghana.", "dataset": ["administrative tax data", "firm-level census data"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "To evaluate the effectiveness of a water filtration technology, we used two datasets: one containing bacteriological test results and another containing survey responses on water-quality perceptions, both collected in rural communities in Haiti.", "dataset": ["bacteriological test results", "survey responses on water-quality perceptions"], "topic": ["Water"]}, {"sentence": "This paper presents results from the analysis of seed production records obtained from five plantations located across Indonesia and Malaysia, with a focus on understanding the effects of climate variability on the yield and quality of oil palm.", "dataset": ["seed production records"], "topic": ["Climate Change","Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using household survey data from the National Sample Survey Office of India, augmented by data on government health spending obtained from the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, we assessed the impact of public health expenditures on health outcomes in rural India.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey Office of India", "Ministry of Health and Family Welfare"], "topic": ["Health", "Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed a unique dataset comprised of historical weather observations, satellite data, and farmer-level agricultural census data to investigate the impact of climate change on crop yields in South Asia.", "dataset": ["historical weather observations", "satellite data", "farmer-level agricultural census data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we combined data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys, the Doing Business Indicators, and the Transparency in Corporate Reporting survey to examine the role of corporate governance in fostering private sector development in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Doing Business Indicators", "Transparency in Corporate Reporting survey"], "topic": ["Governance", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "To understand the factors that contribute to job satisfaction among migrant workers in the UK, we analyzed data from the UK Labour Force Survey, the Migrant Worker Survey, and the Annual Population Survey.", "dataset": ["UK Labour Force Survey", "Migrant Worker Survey", "Annual Population Survey"], "topic": ["Migration", "Jobs & Development"]}]
